actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for 'The Great Lie' (1941). She successfully transitioned from silent films to talkies and is best remembered for her role as the femme fatale Brigid O'Shaughnessy in 'The Maltese Falcon'.

filmography.title: The Maltese Falcon
filmography.role_description: A treacherous femme fatale who hires private eye Sam Spade under false pretenses, dragging him into a quest for a priceless statuette.
filmography.plot: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

filmography.title: The Great Lie
filmography.role_description: A self-centered concert pianist who makes a deal with her rival to give up her baby in exchange for financial security.
filmography.plot: A man's invalid marriage to a concert pianist leads to a complex web of lies involving his former fiancée and a secret baby.

filmography.title: Dodsworth
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic American widow living in Italy who offers a retired auto magnate a second chance at happiness.
filmography.plot: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a long-planned European vacation only to find that they want very different things from life.

filmography.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
filmography.role_description: The warm and steady mother of the Smith family who manages the household and her husband's moods.
filmography.plot: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love.

filmography.title: The Palm Beach Story
filmography.role_description: A man-hungry, much-married heiress who sets her sights on the protagonist's husband.
filmography.plot: A married couple struggling with finances decides to divorce so the wife can marry a rich man and fund her husband's architectural dreams.

filmography.title: Midnight
filmography.role_description: The jealous wife of a wealthy aristocrat who tries to thwart her husband's schemes.
filmography.plot: A chorus girl stranded in Paris is set up by a millionaire to break up his wife's affair with another man.

filmography.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
filmography.role_description: A woman in love with the villainous Rupert of Hentzau who eventually helps the protagonist.
filmography.plot: An Englishman on holiday in Ruritania is recruited to impersonate his distant cousin, the King, to save the crown from a coup.

filmography.title: Red Dust
filmography.role_description: The refined wife of an engineer who has an affair with a rubber plantation owner in Indochina.
filmography.plot: A rubber plantation owner in Indochina is involved in a love triangle with a prostitute and the wife of his new engineer.

filmography.title: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
filmography.role_description: The widow of the man murdered decades earlier, who holds a key secret. Astor's final film role.
filmography.plot: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness when her cousin arrives to evict her.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Agnes Moorehead)

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: The beloved matriarch of the March family who guides her four daughters through life's challenges.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War.

filmography.title: Act of Violence
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic prostitute who helps a tormented veteran facing a vengeful former POW.
filmography.plot: A decorated war hero is stalked by a former POW who claims he betrayed their unit to the Nazis.

filmography.title: Across the Pacific
filmography.role_description: A mysterious woman traveling to Panama who captures the interest of Humphrey Bogart's character.
filmography.plot: A disgraced Army officer goes undercover in Panama to stop a Japanese plot to attack the Panama Canal.

filmography.title: Don Juan
filmography.role_description: The woman who finally captures Don Juan's heart in this groundbreaking sound-synchronized film.
filmography.plot: Don Juan learns that there is more to life than his many conquests when he falls for a woman who resists his charms.

filmography.title: Beau Brummel
filmography.role_description: The love interest of the famous dandy in this silent historical drama starring John Barrymore.
filmography.plot: A British military officer becomes a fashion arbiter and close friend of the Prince of Wales, but his arrogance leads to his downfall.

filmography.title: Desert Fury
filmography.role_description: A tough casino owner who tries to control her rebellious daughter's life.
filmography.plot: A casino owner's daughter falls for a gangster, sparking a conflict involving her mother and the local sheriff.

filmography.title: The Kennel Murder Case
filmography.role_description: The niece of the murder victim in one of the most acclaimed Philo Vance mysteries.
filmography.plot: Detective Philo Vance investigates a locked-room mystery when a man is found dead in a room locked from the inside.

filmography.title: Return to Peyton Place
filmography.role_description: A domineering mother who tries to control her son's life and marriage.
filmography.plot: The publication of a scandalous book about the town of Peyton Place causes upheaval for its residents.

filmography.title: Young at Heart
filmography.role_description: The warm-hearted aunt of the musical Tuttle family.
filmography.plot: A cynical songwriter enters the lives of a musical family and changes the dynamics between three sisters.

filmography.title: Thousands Cheer
filmography.role_description: The mother of the main character in this wartime musical revue.
filmography.plot: An aerialist puts his career on hold to join the army, where he falls for the colonel's daughter.

filmography.title: Brigham Young
filmography.role_description: The loyal wife of the Mormon leader Brigham Young.
filmography.plot: The story of Brigham Young who leads the Mormons across the American West to found Salt Lake City.

filmography.title: A Kiss Before Dying
filmography.role_description: The concerned mother of a young woman targeted by a charming sociopath.
filmography.plot: A ruthless college student resorts to murder in an attempt to marry into a wealthy family.

filmography.title: Any Number Can Play
filmography.role_description: The loving wife of a casino owner who worries about his health and profession.
filmography.plot: A casino owner faces health problems, family issues, and high-stakes gamblers during one tense night.

filmography.title: Cass Timberlane
filmography.role_description: A lively and supportive friend to the younger wife of a judge.
filmography.plot: An older judge marries a spirited young woman from the wrong side of the tracks, facing social disapproval.

filmography.title: Fiesta
filmography.role_description: The mother of a bullfighter who wants to be a composer.
filmography.plot: A retired matador wants his son to follow in his footsteps, but the son prefers music, while his twin sister is the natural bullfighter.

filmography.title: Turnabout
filmography.role_description: A character in this body-swap comedy where a husband and wife switch bodies.
filmography.plot: A husband and wife who are constantly bickering wish they could trade places, and a magical idol grants their wish.

filmography.title: The Hurricane
filmography.role_description: The wife of the tyrannical governor of a South Seas island.
filmography.plot: A Polynesian sailor is unjustly imprisoned by a colonial governor, while a catastrophic hurricane threatens their island.

filmography.title: Paradise for Three
filmography.role_description: A woman seeking a rich husband at a ski resort in this romantic comedy.
filmography.plot: A rich industrialist poses as a poor man to win a contest, while a poor man is mistaken for a millionaire at an Alpine hotel.
